intro: Elatostema pseudolongipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and China. Elatostema pseudolongipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
